name: St. James's Club Morgan Bay

reviews.text: My friend and I returned recently from a most relaxing week at this newly renovated hotel. As we were venturing forth without our husbands, we wanted a hotel that catered more to families than to couples. This was a good choice with thanks,in part, to the many people who put their comments in Travel Advisor. We were able to get a special for the hotel and also for the Air Canada fare. We did not book a package.
reviews.title: Beautifully renovated, good value
Good time Was Had By All
reviews.text: We certainly didn't find the children a nuisance. They were surprisingly well behaved. Families perhaps appeared more pleased with the resort than couples, who might like to dance the night away.

Our room with balcony, in the 500 section, had a beautiful view of the sea and the sunsets. The room itself was a good size with two double beds, refrig, ample cupboard space, iron,ironing board and in wall safe (no charge). The coffee maker was handy for tea or coffee. Initially we left the door open in the evening with the lights on in the room -- two mosquitoes found ME. I was soon applying some deet. Then in the morning we were able to find THEM. We had no further problems.
reviews.title: Almond scores well for customer care

reviews.text: We would recommend that you take a flashlight. I always travel with one. The lights went out for twenty minutes in our room and another evening in the restaurant. The lights on the grounds stayed on during this time.
reviews.title: Depends what you are looking for................

reviews.text: Joy's trip ($75.00 U.S.)along the coast with some 12 other passengers was a most enjoyable day. Do take shoes for the water as it is necessary to walk on small stones where they stop for lunch. We talked to someone who had taken the catamaran which is booked at the hotel tour desk. It was a better choice for her elderly husband who had problems walking and getting in and out of a boat.
reviews.title: Lovely 4* Family Hotel
Very disappointing.
reviews.text: I can only assume that those who have recently posted glowing reports about this resort have either travelled little in the Caribbean or have fairly low standards.
Yes, the resort and rooms are clean and once the planting has become fully established the grounds will be lovely but …..
reviews.title: Toronto couple with a 2 1/2 Year old - FANTASTIC family vacation!
Mostly Great, just a little bad
reviews.text: The rooms are OK but certainly not lavish (the term used in the hotel’s brochure) and the balconies are very small. The shower was poor and even my watering can produces a more forceful spray. Having a coffee maker is great but only if the maid remembers to leave the requisite ingredients (2 days no sugar; 1 day no coffee creamer). On our first day, still tired after the previous day’s travelling, we went back to our room at 4 pm for a nap but the room still hadn’t been made up. I was bitten during the night due to the rooms having no plug-in electronic mosquito killers. The hotel would not provide me with a can of insect spray but would sprayed the room if requested but this has to be asked for on a daily basis.

The beach, although small, would look more attractive if it wasn’t for the over-kill of sunbeds (about 20% in use at any one time). Laid only inches apart, they stretch from one end of the beach to the other and there are 3 rows of them! If you want to sit under the shade of a palm tree, you end up on the back row with the delightful view of 2 rows of sunbeds in front of you. Sea was murky and the rough breaking waves made it impossible to swim on some days and only suitable for strong swimmers on others.
reviews.title: You'll luck out here!!

reviews.text: The Sunset Lounge was a great disappointment and looked more like the café of a rail/bus station with its square metal topped tables each with 4 upright wicker chairs.
reviews.title: Beauty beyond your imgination!!

reviews.text: Stayed at the Almond for 7 nights - Feb 28th
reviews.title: Almond is Fully Ready
Best food in St. Lucia
reviews.text: I am a travel agent and my first time to St. Lucia

reviews.title: Almond Has Another Winner!
reviews.text: The Almond Resort is fully ready. All the pools open and in great condition. The restaurants all open.
The grounds has nice new plantings, all nicely done.
reviews.title: Fab, Just could not find a fault

reviews.text: The beach is small but typical for the island.
reviews.title: dont drink the water
Banana Shakes with Malibu...
reviews.text: If you like... banana milkshakes with malibu in a swim up bar, sailing in the caribbean, stunning sunsets, great food, friendly people, warm sunshine with a cool breeze and all in all a fantastic time away... then i couldn't recommend this place more highly.

My girlfriend (although the Stage MC of a tongue twisting competition i was drawn into and came second in assumed she was my wife... one day i reckon) and I had a memorable week from Feb 19th to 26th. We can confirm that any fears of unfinished buildings/landscaping at the hotel are unfounded... the pools are clean, all the restaurants are complete, and i'd strongly recommend going for an ocean view room if you can!!!
reviews.title: Beautiful resort, very friendly & helpful staff

reviews.text: In terms of trips I'd say avoid the overpriced corporate spiel likely to be pitched to you by your travel company on arrival... and instead take a stroll down the beach, where sat chillin beneath a tree you will find a man called 'Joy', and he be bringin' ya plenty of joy on his excursions for half the price of the 'redcoats'. Speedboat out to the volcanoes, marine reserve snorkelling, beachside bbq, waterfalls - you get the picture!
reviews.title: A Slice of Heaven
Great Week
reviews.text: We went as a couple but the families and kids we met seemed just as content as our good selves... kids club, shallow pool, lots of watersports etc.

reviews.title: it's come a long way in such a short time
reviews.text: Only thing that would stop me going again would be the urge i now have to see another Caribbean island such as Antigua or Barbados. But for me, if you have the opportunity to go here then seize it... we don't regret it and neither will you!

aka: Morgan Bay Beach Hotel Gros Islet
description: Escape from reality at the four-star St. James's Club Morgan Bay, St. Lucia. A fun, relaxing, and casually elegant Caribbean beach resort. Famous for its friendly staff, amazing tropical gardens, and great service. St. James's Club Morgan Bay is an excellent choice for couples, families, weddings, honeymoons, family reunions, and more. This resort has 345 rooms in total for its Caribbean vacationers. Guests can relax and enjoy terrific garden view, beachfront, and ocean view suite accommodations.
